*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, Monterey, January 14, 1834. Announcing arrest, discussing past policies, and advising tranquillity.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Monterey */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="01-14-1834">Jany. 14 1834*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr *person_mentioned*Brother */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Sister*/person_mentioned*,*/p*
*p*The affairs of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*are likely to cost me much trouble and expense in addition to what I have already undergone since I left home. The *person_mentioned*state govt*/person_mentioned*, have made an accusation against me of some kind, to the *person_mentioned*genl Govt*/person_mentioned*, and I was arrested on the *date_mentioned n="01-03-1834">3rd inst*/date_mentioned*. at *location_mentioned*Saltillo */location_mentioned*on my arrival there and shall leave in a few days for *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*as a *person_mentioned*state prisoner*/person_mentioned*. Give yourselves no kind of uneasiness about this matter— it can do me no other harm that [than] the delay and expense—all I can be accused of is that I have labored most diligently and indefatigably to get *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*made a state separate from *location_mentioned*Coahuila*/location_mentioned*, and that is no crime, nor no dishonor—it is quite the reverse*/p*
*p*I made some *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*for opposing a *location_mentioned*territory*/location_mentioned*, but I have many good *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*, who will see justice done me and amongst them, the *person_mentioned*vice President*/person_mentioned* himself*/p*
*p*It is very likely that I may be hammered and pummeled about for a year before I get home again, but I think that good will come of it for *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. The *date_mentioned n="04-06-1830">April */date_mentioned*law is repealed and before I quit the matter I hope to see some other remedies. I did not like the manner this question was started I wanted *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*to take the lead—but so it is— you must all now harmonize more with *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Goliad */location_mentioned*and have union—and no more party spirit. I suppose that some of my *person_mentioned*enemies in the *location_mentioned*colony*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* will rejoice at what they may think or hope will be my ruin—-no good man will envy them their joy, nor participate in it.*/p*
*p*I have been very kindly treated by the *person_mentioned*Commandant General Don Pedro Lemus*/person_mentioned* and by the *person_mentioned*Govr. of this state*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Col. Ugartechea */person_mentioned*and have no cause to complain on that score. I hope when *person_mentioned*Genl Lemus*/person_mentioned* visits *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*my *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*there will remember that he befriended me very much.*/p*
*p*I hope there will be no excitement about my arrest—-it will do me harm and no good to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, that is unless I should be unjustly dealt by, in that case there will be cause for excitement.*/p*
*p*I have requested *person_mentioned*Williams */person_mentioned*to provide me with the means of living in *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*, it is likely I may want as much as one thousand dollars, tho I do not know.*/p*
*p*Collect all the stock you can in claims due me and put them *location_mentioned*on your farm at Chocolate Bayou*/location_mentioned*, in your own brand—call on *person_mentioned*Williams*/person_mentioned* for the claims and hire some one to collect them.*/p*
*p*When I return I wish to make my *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*at your *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*and hope you will have a room or cabbin for me.*/p*
*p*I send you some seeds of a beautiful tree in shape like a lombardy poplar, in foliage like a cedar—sow them—in a bed like pepper seed—raise the bed so that the water will not lay on it—water them in dry weather, protect them from frost in the winter when young, and from the hot sun in the middle of the day, by a bush or mat. They will do to transplant the second or third year—take special care of them. I have many seeds and my miniature taken in *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned* by *person_mentioned*Wm Howard*/person_mentioned* who intends to visit *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*, I recommend him to you very particularly. I cannot send these things to you now. So will give away the seeds and take the miniature to *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*again.*/p*
*p*You have suffered a great affliction since I left in the loss of dear little *person_mentioned*Mary*/person_mentioned*, and in the sweep made by the cholera—it is dread full but without remedy—my good friends *person_mentioned*John Austin*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Westall*/person_mentioned*, and many others are gone. I sympathize sincerely with you all—poor *person_mentioned*Henry */person_mentioned*too has his share and more than a share of affliction—it is dreadfull indeed.*/p*
*p*Remember me to*person_mentioned* Mrs. Westall*/person_mentioned*—to the *person_mentioned*McNiels*/person_mentioned*, and *person_mentioned*Munson*/person_mentioned*, to *person_mentioned*Phillips */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Eliza*/person_mentioned*, and do not let *person_mentioned*little Stephen*/person_mentioned* and your *person_mentioned*children*/person_mentioned* forget me, I hope they will some day be benefited by my labors.*/p*
*p*remember me to *person_mentioned*Henry */person_mentioned*particularly—I have not received a line from you since I left home*/p*
*p*Cotton is worth about 30 cents in *location_mentioned*San Luis Potosí*/location_mentioned*—the freight from *location_mentioned*Tampico */location_mentioned*is from eight to nine dollars a hundred. If you wish for information write to *person_mentioned*Dall */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Drege */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*San Luis Potosi*/location_mentioned*—*person_mentioned*Henry*/person_mentioned* knows them*/p*
*p*God bless you—farewell—your *person_mentioned*brother*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*It is very rare that a man who labors for the genl good of thousands, or for a whole *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, can escape persecution and detraction—no man did more good than *person_mentioned*DeWitt Clinton*/person_mentioned* for the state of *location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned*, but he did it against a torrent of abuse slander and opposition. *person_mentioned*Smith */person_mentioned*the father and champion of the infant colony at *location_mentioned*Jamestown */location_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Virginia */location_mentioned*was even banished by those whom he had labor'd for. Party spirit and envy only see with their own eyes and for their own ends—they are everything that is uncharitable malignant, selfish, anti moral and anti honest—the mass of the people, the honest laboring class think of their *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*and their domestic concerns, and are therefore easily mislead by *person_mentioned*demagogues */person_mentioned*and designing or envious men, who only think how to destroy and involve others to build up themselves. It is well known that I have always been opposed to violent measures in *location_mentioned*Tejas */location_mentioned*and that I have always been the friend and a sincere one of the *person_mentioned*Mexicans*/person_mentioned*. Party spirit has tryed to make this a crime in me. I wished to smother this spirit because history shows that the most dangerous enemy to *location_mentioned*new colonies*/location_mentioned* and *location_mentioned*infant communities*/location_mentioned* is division and discord amongst themselves, and I resorted to conciliating, yielding and passive means to keep down party spirit, when perhaps I ought to have adopted the reverse. Up to *date_mentioned n="xx-xx-1830">1830 */date_mentioned*my sistem was not interfered with, and all went well, but since then, all has been confusion—and my *person_mentioned*enemies */person_mentioned*have succeeded to their utmost wish in involving me in difficulty—had I been as vindictive against them, as they have against me, and called the *person_mentioned*old settlers*/person_mentioned* and sound part of the people to rally a-round me. I could have easily crushed my *person_mentioned*enemies*/person_mentioned*—but they [would] have been totalty ruined, and I did not wish to ruin even the worst enemy I had on earth. They have tryed violent measures and gained nothing but trouble, let them now try peace and harmony awhile and let the country advance in population and resourses. The favourable reforms and changes are taking place in the*person_mentioned* Mexican government*/person_mentioned* and people, and a little time will put all right—there will be toleration of religion—*location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*will be a state and all will go right— but above all things the colonists must harmonize with *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Goliad*/location_mentioned*. In the beginning of *date_mentioned n="10-xx-1833">October */date_mentioned*I lost patience I recd a letter then from *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*that irritated me, also some things occured in *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*that soured and discouraged me, and I wrote to the *person_mentioned*Ayuntamientos */person_mentioned*a letter which is the cause of my arrest—since then favourable changes have taken place. There is no sort of doubt of the right of the *person_mentioned*people of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* to take care of themselves, if there be no other remedy—this is very clear—it is more than a right—it is a duty—but evil may be done by precipitation. The evil in these matters is that ambitious and bad men wish for revolution, and they take advantage of a fevered state of public opinion, to hurry the people into it, when it is not necessary—in such cases the *person_mentioned*actors */person_mentioned*gain, and the instruments loose.*/p*
*p*As I before said, when I return I will make my home at your house. I will not have anything more to do with public business if I can honorably and consistantly avoid it*/p*
*p*I am told that *person_mentioned*Sterling Robinson*/person_mentioned* has made charges to the *person_mentioned*state Govt*/person_mentioned*, against me. I think it unkind that such a man as that should be made use of as an instrument by others, to try and ruin me—but all this is in the regular course of things with envy and party spirit.*/p*
*p*Keep yourself totally clear of politics and party and seek happiness within the limits of your *location_mentioned*farm */location_mentioned*and the circle of your *person_mentioned*family*/person_mentioned* and personal *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*, and I will join that circle as soon as I can, it is the only place where I expect to find quiet or happiness— adios*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*the most certain way for letters to reach me is to direct them to *person_mentioned*William Parrott, merchant, Mexico*/person_mentioned*, and send them to *location_mentioned*Tampico*/location_mentioned*, or *location_mentioned*Vera Cruz*/location_mentioned*, to be put in the mail there—if there is no other opportunity, send them by way of *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned*, I saw *person_mentioned*Baldwin */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Mexico */location_mentioned*and put a letter in the mail here from him to you—-he has lost and suffered much.*/p*
*/div1*
